meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Jack Pitney Catherine Menser Bruce Simmons Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #1768.

div.div:
Bruce Simmons game 3.
Missing player introductions and part of Final Jeopardy!

td.p: Jack Pitney, a college teacher from
Catherine Menser, a pharmacist from Houston, Texas
Bruce Simmons, a grad student from Minneapolis, Minnesota (whose 2-day cash winnings total $31,900)

tr.td: ANIMAL FACTS
OLD MOVIES
BLACK INVENTORS
PRESIDENTIAL ASTROLOGY
SONGS OF THE '50s
"HANG" TIME

Bruce
')

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_DJ_6_5', 'clue_DJ_6_5_stuck', '(Catherine: What\'s a Kay Plan?)
(Alex: Would you say it again?)
(Catherine: What\'s a Key Plan?)
(Alex: No, I\'m sorry. It is not called the Key Plan or the Kay Plan. It\'s the [*], K-E-O...K-E-O...there\'s no U...G-H Plan. Gosh I\'m sorry it didn\'t work out for you.)

Keogh (Plan)

Catherine
')

Catherine
Jack
(lock game)

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '[Bruce\'s response, wager, and final score were cut off the archiving tape. Per additional sources, he won this game with a score of $14,999. His Final Jeopardy! play has been approximated here.]
CatherineWho is Miguel de Cervantes
$1,800
JackWho was Cervantes
$2,000
BruceWho is Cervantes?
$999
Miguel de Cervantes')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'His exact birthday is unknown, but it\'s believed to be Sept. 29, 1547, the feast day of San Miguel')

tr.td: AUTHORS
His exact birthday is unknown, but it's believed to be Sept. 29, 1547, the feast day of San Miguel
Bruce
Catherine
Jack
3-day champion: $46,899
3rd place: N/A
2nd place: a trip for 2 to the Bahamas Princess Resort & Casino
Bruce
Catherine
Jack

(including 1 DD),
